sub_title: Creatieveling in de zorg. Zie klaasbaas.com
summary: Ik ben Klaas-Jan en sinds 2020 werkzaam bij Bartiméus als begeleider bij de de afdeling Vrije Tijd en Radio Bartje. Hiernaast ben ik werkzaam als audio- redacteur bij Dedicon en  als freelance projectmanager op het snijvlak van cultuur en onderwijs. Mijn Linked-in profiel is nog onder constructie maar meer info is te vinden op www.klaasbaas.com.

projects.title: Organisator Monday Meetup
projects.description:
Iedere laatste maandag van de maand stelt Seats2meet.com Utrecht CS of Meeting Plaza, the World of Society 3.0 van 14:00 tot 17:00 haar open lounge, discussietafels en een aantal meetingspaces ter beschikking.

In een creatieve en inspirerende setting faciliteert Seats2meet.com of Meeting Plaza, the World of Society 3.0 haar crowd om op een open podium kennis te delen, kennis op te doen, elkaar te ontmoeten en de gedeelde netwerken te onderhouden en uit te bouwen.

contributors.headline: Creatieveling in de zorg. Zie klaasbaas.com

projects.title: Productionmanager at De Kinderen van de Staat: Rubiks Cube @ Distelweg 113
projects.description: A Rubiks Cube themed music event where people had to switch clothes with each other till they had a matching pair of clothes in a single color.

contributors.headline: Creatieveling in de zorg. Zie klaasbaas.com
Cameraman - Sergeant Majoor BDAV (Chief Petty Officer- Royal Netherlands Navy (RNLR))
Eventsmanager & Decorator @ INI Movement || Indoor- Outdoor promotor @ Nice2Know

profile_positions.description:
Dedicon maakt o.a. luistermagazines voor mensen met een visuele beperking. Of je nu van computers houdt, mode of meer van proza en poëzie, voor ieder wat wils. 

Luistertijdschrift Hardop is een magazine voor kinderen van 5 tot 10 jaar met allerlei weetjes, verhalen, gedichtjes, moppen, raadsels, een prijsvraag. Ik schrijf hiervoor het script.
profile_positions.title: Redacteur audio

profile_positions.description: Als begeleider bij zorginstelling Bartimeus werk ik met mensen die net even anders zijn. Ze zijn slechtziend of zelfs blind en hebben daarnaast ook nog een verstandelijke beperking. Maar wat blijkt; de bewoners zijn -stuk voor stuk- enorm talentvol! Ik krijg energie om hen te laten groeien en bloeien, hoe klein de gemaakte stappen ook mogen zijn.
profile_positions.title: Activiteiten begeleider Vrije Tijd En Radio Bartje

profile_positions.description:
‘Wow, ik had niet verwacht dat Wesley zo goed kon acteren!’ Het was die uitspraak van Cindy die mij in de zomer van 2021 ontzettend ontroerde.

Cindy zei dit vlak na de eerste try-out van Koekoek! waar ze, samen met een stel enthousiaste mede-bewoners van zorginstelling Bartiméus, als allereerste de voorstelling mocht beleven. Dolgelukkig stuurde ik direct de betrokken stemacteurs een audiobericht: ‘Yesss; ze vonden het goed!’

Het doel was hiermee bereikt; Wesley heeft zelf namelijk ook een visuele en verstandelijke beperking maar in zijn rol als Mick Koekoek toont hij dat dit zijn talent niet in de weg hoeft te zitten. 

Als begeleider bij Bartimeus werk ik met mensen die net even anders zijn. Ze zijn slechtziend of zelfs blind en hebben daarnaast ook nog een verstandelijke beperking. Maar wat blijkt; de bewoners zijn -stuk voor stuk- enorm talentvol! Zo werd ik dus blij verrast toen ik hoorde hoe goed Wesley stemmen kan imiteren en ik ontdekte dat Christiaan een professionele Radio-DJ bleek te zijn. Of neem het acteertalent van Lotte: haar dramatische snik was tijdens een activiteit zo echt dat de begeleiding haar wilde troosten. Nergens voor nodig!

Zo ontstond het idee om samen een hoorspel te maken. Niet zomaar eentje; een spannende voorstelling in het donker moest het worden. Een beleving. Eentje waarbij mensen zonder een beperking kunnen ervaren hoe het is om (bijvoorbeeld) blind te zijn.

Met behulp van een stel creatieve mede-ondernemers en de steun van het Bartimeus Fonds is mijn droom inmiddels werkelijkheid geworden. Samen hebben we het afgelopen jaar hard gewerkt aan een kindervoorstelling waarin een bont gezelschap bewijst dat het niet erg is als je anders bent. Want iedereen heeft een talent…
profile_positions.title: ontwikkelaar Theatervoorstelling Koekoek

profile_positions.description:
Slowly we are starting to realize that the supply of raw materials of our earth, for example gas, is not endless. Luckily there are many alternatives to heat up our homes without damaging the earth.

ANNE is a new event location in Utrecht that intents to inspire people about such alternatives with 7 meeting rooms. Guests are welcome to visit or organize a meeting or  event about the topic of sustainability. The circular design and the demonstration of materials, heat pumps, and solar panels contribute to this awareness.

At ANNE I’ve been working as Manager since November 2017. In less than six months, the place has grown enormously in terms of turnover and brand-awareness. Surveys showed that guests like it here and want to return. Everything that I learned during my studies and in my working years is clicking into place at ANNE!

Oops... i almost forgot to mention; did you hear about the about the Climate planet festival? Thanks to our crowdfunding campaign this huge event will come to Utrecht. Climate Planet is a 360 degree movie and an experience that you shouldn't miss. The movie can be seen in a huge globe that will placed at the Jaarbeursplein in October 2018. I'm so excited!
profile_positions.title: LOCATION MANAGER @ ANNE

profile_positions.description:
After finishing high school, kids become students: this means a new adventure, on a new school and in a new city. For many of them this is an uncertain time during which they are surrounded by many new faces. Wouldn’t it be great if everyone got to know each other by playing a game? This is why I developed WipwApp, a mobile citygame application that lets you experience the city in a new way.

WipwApp was used during introduction weeks for students in a number of cities. I designed custom tours for Hogeschool Amsterdam, Technische Universiteit Eindhoven and Windesheim Zwolle. More than 2000 students played the game. I was also commissioned by bol.com and Culturele Zondagen Utrecht to create a custom tour for the application.

WipwApp was build for both IOS and Android and developed in collaboration with Code 3 New Media Projects.
profile_positions.title: DEVELOPING WIPWAPP MOBILE CITY GAME APPLICATION

profile_positions.description:
Flying like a bird, swimming in a bath full of spaghetti or performing as a singer in a full stadium: these are just some of the dreams that came true during de Droomshow.

What? How?

De Droomshow is an acceleration program (comparable to hackathons) in which participants are guided in finding and developing solutions for both digital and analogue challenges.

The sessions are a mix of brainstorming techniques, inspirational exercises and just plain fun, and are based on existing formats such as Sprint and hackathons. The difference with other sessions is that the show element is very high. The Dream Show is a magical party where everything is possible.

During the first edition, participants made each others’ dreams come true. During the second edition they started developing bizarre inventions. How about a machine that washes and folds your clothes ...

What I hoped turned out to be true: De droomshow proves that many things are possible in a short time!
profile_positions.title: DEVELOPING 'DE DROOMSHOW'

profile_positions.description:
Seats2meet is an on- and offline space to meet, work, exchange knowledge and create ideas. It is even an place to work together and strength each other.

Besides the on and offline co-working space Seats2meet facilitates several meetingspaces. For the flagshipstore in Utrecht i am host and in charge of bookings and facility management
profile_positions.title: SERVICE MANAGEMENT @ SEATS2MEET UTRECHT

profile_positions.description:
Seats2meet is a meeting concept and shares in abundance. At a time when access is more important than property, Seats2meet facilitates sharing knowledge, and expansion and interconnection of value networks. In short: relevant physical encounters, collaboration and opportunities for your own network.

While working as freelancer for Seats2meet I organized a monthly network event: a diverse and inspiring program of workshops, book presentations, webinars, inspiration and discussion, concluded by an informal reception with snacks and drinks.
profile_positions.title: ORGANISING NETWORK EVENTS @ SEATS2MEET UTRECHT

profile_positions.description: On the 26th of June the technology festival “IT = ME” took place in the library of Nieuwegein. IT=ME was a family festival about new technologies, virtual reality, social media and more. With lectures, demonstrations and do-it-yourself workshops we informed and inspired the audience about new technological developments. Children could code their own game, build a robot or participate in a social media detective game. Adults could relax with the Muse EEC brain scanner, or listen to a lecture on “the internet of things” and try out related gadgets.
profile_positions.title: ORGANISING TECHNOLOGY FESTIVAL

profile_positions.description:
Minecraft is currently one the most popular games in the world. It is a kind of digital Lego: players build a world that consists of square blocks. They can collect different pieces, places and tools to build houses and other constructions. With the rare materials players can do special things in the endless creational world of Minecraft.

Playing Minecraft is fun but also very instructive. It can be used to prepare children for a world defined by technology and teach them 21st century-skills. This is why the library of Nieuwegein asked me to organize Minecraft tournaments. In two tournaments more than 150 children were building the cities of the future. The tournaments had different themes: the first was about sustainability, the second about tolerance. The results were stunning, and hopefully our future cities will be like their imagination…
profile_positions.title: ORGANISING MINECRAFT TOURNAMENTS

profile_positions.description:
Minecraft Toolkit is a website that can be used for Minecraft tournaments such as the ones I organized for the Library of Nieuwegein. We received funding from the National Library to develop a toolkit to enable and encourage libraries to organize a similar tournament.

The aim of the toolkit is to provide all information necessary for libraries to organize their own tournament. The site was built as a toolkit with five video episodes. In an informal talkshow setting I interviewed experts. In the video epsiodes, we explained what Minecraft is, how to use it for educational purposes, how to create a tournament, the technical matters and the risks of organizing an event. Also, because this was the first time I hosted a talkshow, we had plenty of material for a special blooper episode.
profile_positions.title: DEVELOPING MINECRAFT TOOLKIT

profile_positions.description:
In the summer of 2015 the start of the Tour de France was located in Utrecht. To celebrate this event the municipality of Utrecht initiated La Caravane d’Utrecht; a procession trough the city centre with hundreds of costumed participants.

A delegation of different citizens of Utrecht was present, among which were also refugee kids from the local asylum centers. This part was organized by Safari Utrecht, and I was asked to do the project management. We developed workshops in the asylum centers so the 40 kids could make their own music and costumes to show in the parade. It was a wonderful celebration, and I was honored to be able to facilitate something meaningful in the uncertain lives of these kids.
profile_positions.title: PROJECT MANAGEMENT: LA CARAVANE D’UTRECHT FOR REFUGEE KIDS

profile_positions.description:
From 2010 to 2012 I worked for Huisbrand events, a parent company of several event agencies such as Mokum Events, Holland Tour Guides en Actief Events.

During that time I developed city games for business trips and bachelor parties. I transformed popular television concepts such as Wie is de Mol, Expeditie Robinson and Crazy to games for the city streets. While carrying mobile phones, maps, questionnaires and GPS devices the participants would discover the city, and each other.
profile_positions.title: DEVELOPING CITYGAMES FOR BUSINESS TRIPS AND BACHELOR PARTYS
